qas.question: When did Presbyterianism arrive in America?
In what city was the first Presbytery formed?
In what year would the original churches evolve into the Presbyterian Church in the United States of America?
What is the name of the largest denomination of the Presbyterian Church in America?
In which year did the Bible first arrive in Colonial America?
When did America arrive in Presbyterianism?
In what year was Philadelphia brought to Colonial America?
In what year was the presbytery joined by 3 more to form a synod?
In what year was the Presbyterian Church in Colonial America established?

context: Presbyterianism first officially arrived in Colonial America in <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0><b6_0>1703<b6_0/><b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> with the establishment of the first Presbytery in <a1_0>Philadelphia<a1_0/>. In time, the presbytery would be joined by two more to form a synod (<b7_0>1717<b7_0/>) and would eventually evolve into the Presbyterian Church in the United States of America in <a2_0><b8_0>1789<b8_0/><a2_0/>. The nation's largest Presbyterian denomination, <a3_0>the Presbyterian Church (U.S.A.)<a3_0/> – PC (USA) – can trace their heritage back to the original PCUSA, as can the Presbyterian Church in America (PCA), the Orthodox Presbyterian Church (OPC), the Bible Presbyterian Church (BPC), the Cumberland Presbyterian Church (CPC), the Cumberland Presbyterian Church in America the Evangelical Presbyterian Church (EPC) and the Evangelical Covenant Order of Presbyterians (ECO).
